instructions:
In a 10 inch frying pan add pork cubes to peanut oil and brown for about 3 minutes. Add onions and sauté
with pork for another 3 minutes. Combine water, soy sauce, mushroom liquid and stir in chop suey mix.
Add to pork and simmer till it thickens *(if too thick add liquid)*. Add drained vegetables and mushrooms and
simmer for about 5 minutes or until heated through. Serve over rice and top with crisp noodles. Serves 4.
ingredients: 1/2 lb pork cubes (cut from pork blade or butt steak)
1 bunch green onions, sliced 1/4 inch bias
2 cans (14 oz ea) chop suey vegetables, drained
1 can (4 oz) sliced mushrooms, save liquid
name: Chop Suey
